div.p: ML MSS.562, Letters to E. P. Ramsay 1862-91, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

I think, dear Dr Ramsay, that I sent you a book on nebular theory, of which the author J. Spottiswoode Wilson, a former travelling companion of mine, appointed by Sir Rod. Murchison sent me some Copies.
J. S. Wilson travelled as geologist on the North Australian Exploring Expedition, 1855-6. The book in question was presumably J. S. Wilson (1890). Uncautiously I sent them out, before I had read them, and now find to my horror, that the book contains some irreligious passages in the worst of wordings. Should you therefore have received this highly objectionable book, please destroy it. You will be aware that I am a strict adherent to christian faith.
